name: Introduction to JavaScript + Code Node Basics

parameters.content:
## JSON vs JavaScript

JSON (Data Storage):

• Organizes and structures data
• Static - just sits there
• Like a recipe listing ingredients

JavaScript (Data Processing):

• Programming language that DOES things
• Reads, transforms, creates data
• Like the chef using the recipe

## Code Node Benefits

• Consistency - Works exactly the same every time
• Reliability - Set it up once and it just works
• Cost-Free - No AI tokens or API costs
• Speed - Executes in milliseconds
• No Data Limits - Can handle unlimited data

## CODE NODE = THE KITCHEN
(Where the magic happens in N8N)

## JAVASCRIPT = THE CHEF

• Reads the recipe (JSON data)
• Heats oven to right temperature
• Mixes ingredients in right order
• Decides if needs more cooking time
• Creates final dish description

## JSON = RECIPE

• Name: "Pizza"
• Temperature: 350°F
• Ingredients: ["dough", "sauce", "cheese"]
(Static data - just lists ingredients)
